comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Albert Gustav Winterhalter (October 5, 1856 - June 5, 1920) was an admiral in the United States Navy. He was commander in chief of the U.S. Asiatic Fleet from 1915 to 1917." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_G._Winterhalter According to the Tulsa daily world., January 16, 1916, MORNING EDITION, SECOND SECTION, Image 15, last column, Winterhalter was invitated on December 8, 1915 to the imperial palace at Tokyo. The New York Times, November 10, 1915 indicates that there were already in November 1915 a series of luncheons and dinners at Kyoto on the occasion of the coronation of the Mikado, possibly with the presence of Winterhalter.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
